_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

Four qualities of a foolish, incompetent: Without examining or scrutinizing, they praise those deserving of criticism
They criticize those deserving of praise
They arouse faith in things that are dubious
They don’t arouse faith in things that are inspiring
Four qualities of an astute, competent g: After examining and scrutinizing, they criticize those deserving of criticism
They praise those deserving of praise
They don’t arouse faith in things that are dubious
They do arouse faith in things that are inspiring
Time period and consequences of slanderi: For more than two quinquadecillion years
A slanderer of noble ones goes to hell
Having aimed bad words and thoughts at them.
